title: Summary of correlations as HTML table — tab_corr
text: data Matrix correlation coefficients returned cor-function, data.frame variables correlations columns computed. na.deletion Indicates missing values treated. May either "listwise" (default) "pairwise". May abbreviated. corr.method Indicates correlation computation method. May one "pearson" (default), "spearman" "kendall". May abbreviated. title String, used table caption. var.labels Character vector variable names, used label variables output. wrap.labels Numeric, determines many chars value, variable axis labels displayed one line line break inserted. show.p Logical, TRUE, p-values also printed. p.numeric Logical, TRUE, p-values printed numbers. FALSE (default), asterisks used. fade.ns Logical, TRUE (default), non-significant correlation-values appear faded (using lighter grey text color). See 'Note'. val.rm Specify number 0 1 suppress output correlation values smaller val.rm. absolute correlation values used, correlation value -.5 greater val.rm = .4 thus omitted. default, argument NULL, hence values shown table. correlation value specified value val.rm, still printed HTML table, made "invisible" white foreground color. can use CSS argument ("css.valueremove") change color appearance correlation value smaller limit specified val.rm. digits Amount decimals estimates triangle Indicates whether upper right (use "upper"), lower left (use "lower") (use "") triangles correlation table filled values. Default "". can specifiy inital letter . string.diag vector string values length ncol(data) (number correlated items) can used display content diagonal cells row column item identical (.e. "self-correlation"). defauilt, argument NULL diagnal cells empty. CSS list user-defined style-sheet-definitions, according official CSS syntax. See 'Details' package-vignette. encoding Character vector, indicating charset encoding used variable value labels. Default "UTF-8". Windows Systems, encoding = "Windows-1252" might necessary proper display special characters. file Destination file, output saved file. NULL (default), output saved temporary file opened either IDE's viewer pane default web browser. use.viewer Logical, TRUE, HTML table shown IDE's viewer pane. FALSE viewer available, HTML table opened web browser. remove.spaces Logical, TRUE, leading spaces removed lines final string contains html-data. Use , want remove parantheses html-tags. html-source may look less pretty, may help exporting html-tables office tools.

title: Summary of correlations as HTML table — tab_corr
code: if (FALSE) { if (interactive()) {   # Data from the EUROFAMCARE sample dataset   library(sjmisc)   data(efc)    # retrieve variable and value labels   varlabs <- get_label(efc)    # recveive first item of COPE-index scale   start <- which(colnames(efc) == "c83cop2")   # recveive last item of COPE-index scale   end <- which(colnames(efc) == "c88cop7")    # create data frame with COPE-index scale   mydf <- data.frame(efc[, c(start:end)])   colnames(mydf) <- varlabs[c(start:end)]    # we have high correlations here, because all items   # belong to one factor.   tab_corr(mydf, p.numeric = TRUE)    # auto-detection of labels, only lower triangle   tab_corr(efc[, c(start:end)], triangle = "lower")    # auto-detection of labels, only lower triangle, all correlation   # values smaller than 0.3 are not shown in the table   tab_corr(efc[, c(start:end)], triangle = "lower", val.rm = 0.3)    # auto-detection of labels, only lower triangle, all correlation   # values smaller than 0.3 are printed in blue   tab_corr(efc[, c(start:end)], triangle = "lower",val.rm = 0.3,            CSS = list(css.valueremove = 'color:blue;')) }}

title: Summary of item analysis of an item scale as HTML table — tab_itemscale
text: Shapiro-Wilk Normality Test (see column W(p)) tests item distribution significantly different normal. Item difficulty range 0.2 0.8. Ideal value p+(1-p)/2 (mostly 0.5 0.8). item discrimination, acceptable values 0.20 higher; closer 1.00 better. See item_reliability details. case total Cronbach's Alpha value acceptable cut-0.7 (mostly index items), mean inter-item-correlation alternative measure indicate acceptability. Satisfactory range lies 0.2 0.4. See also item_intercor.

title: Summary of item analysis of an item scale as HTML table — tab_itemscale
code: # Data from the EUROFAMCARE sample dataset library(sjmisc) library(sjlabelled) data(efc)  # retrieve variable and value labels varlabs <- get_label(efc)  # recveive first item of COPE-index scale start <- which(colnames(efc) == "c82cop1") # recveive last item of COPE-index scale end <- which(colnames(efc) == "c90cop9")  # create data frame with COPE-index scale mydf <- data.frame(efc[, start:end]) colnames(mydf) <- varlabs[start:end]  if (FALSE) { if (interactive()) {   tab_itemscale(mydf)    # auto-detection of labels   tab_itemscale(efc[, start:end])    # Compute PCA on Cope-Index, and perform a   # item analysis for each extracted factor.   indices <- tab_pca(mydf)$factor.index   tab_itemscale(mydf, factor.groups = indices)    # or, equivalent   tab_itemscale(mydf, factor.groups = "auto") }}

title: Print regression models as HTML table — tab_model
text: ... One regression models, including glm's mixed models. May also list fitted models. See 'Examples'. transform character vector, naming function applied estimates confidence intervals. default, transform automatically use "exp" transformation applicable classes model (e.g. logistic poisson regression). Estimates linear models remain untransformed. Use NULL want raw, non-transformed estimates. show.intercept Logical, TRUE, intercepts printed. show.est Logical, TRUE, estimates printed. show.ci Either logical, TRUE, confidence intervals printed table; FALSE, confidence intervals omitted. numeric, 0 1, indicating range confidence intervals. show.ci50 Logical, TRUE, Bayesian models, second credible interval added table output. show.se Logical, TRUE, standard errors also printed. robust standard errors required, use arguments vcov.fun, vcov.type vcov.args (see standard_error details). show.std Indicates whether standardized beta-coefficients also printed, yes, type standardization done. See 'Details'. show.p Logical, TRUE, p-values also printed. show.stat Logical, TRUE, coefficients' test statistic also printed. show.df Logical, TRUE p.val = "kr", p-values linear mixed models based df Kenward-Rogers approximation. df-values printed. See p_value details. show.zeroinf Logical, TRUE model zero-inflated model part, also printed table. show.r2 Logical, TRUE, r-squared value also printed. Depending model, might pseudo-r-squared values, Bayesian r-squared etc. See r2 details. show.icc Logical, TRUE, prints intraclass correlation coefficient mixed models. See icc details. show.re.var Logical, TRUE, prints random effect variances mixed models. See get_variance details. show.ngroups Logical, TRUE, shows number random effects groups mixed models. show.fstat Logical, TRUE, F-statistics model printed table summary. option supported model types. show.aic Logical, TRUE, AIC value model printed table summary. show.aicc Logical, TRUE, second-order AIC value model printed table summary. show.dev Logical, TRUE, shows deviance model. show.loglik Logical, TRUE, shows log-Likelihood model. show.obs Logical, TRUE, number observations per model printed table summary. show.reflvl Logical, TRUE, additional row inserted table predictor type factor, indicate reference level related factor. terms Character vector names terms (variables) printed table. terms removed output. NULL, terms printed. Note term names must match names model's coefficients. factors, means variable name suffixed related factor level, category counts one term. E.g. rm.terms = "t_name [2,3]" remove terms "t_name2" "t_name3" (assuming variable t_name categorical least factor levels 2 3). Another example iris-dataset: terms = "Species" work, instead use terms = "Species [versicolor,virginica]". rm.terms Character vector names indicate terms removed output Counterpart terms. rm.terms = "t_name" remove term t_name. Default NULL, .e. terms used. factors, levels removed plot need explicitly indicated square brackets, match model's coefficient names, e.g. rm.terms = "t_name [2,3]" remove terms "t_name2" "t_name3" (assuming variable t_name categorical least factor levels 2 3). order.terms Numeric vector, indicating order coefficients plotted. See examples package-vignette. keep, drop Character containing regular expression pattern describes parameters included (keep) excluded (drop) returned data frame. keep may also named list regular expressions. non-matching parameters removed output. keep one element, merged operator regular expression pattern like : "(one|two|three)". See details ?parameters::model_parameters. title String, used table caption. pred.labels Character vector labels predictor variables. NULL, pred.labels used first table column predictors' names. default, auto.label = TRUE data labelled, term_labels called retrieve labels coefficients, used predictor labels. data labelled, format_parameters() used create pretty labels. pred.labels = "" auto.label = FALSE, raw variable names used model formula used predictor labels. pred.labels named vector, predictor labels (default, names model's coefficients) matched names pred.labels. ensures labels always match related predictor table, matter way predictors sorted. See 'Examples'. dv.labels Character vector labels dependent variables fitted models. dv.labels = "", row names dependent variables omitted table. wrap.labels Numeric, determines many chars value, variable axis labels displayed one line line break inserted. bootstrap Logical, TRUE, returns bootstrapped estimates.. iterations Numeric, number bootstrap iterations (default 1000). seed Numeric, number seed replicate bootstrapped estimates. NULL, uses random seed. robust Deprecated. Please use vcov.fun directly specify estimation variance-covariance matrix. vcov.fun Variance-covariance matrix used compute uncertainty estimates (e.g., robust standard errors). argument accepts covariance matrix, function returns covariance matrix, string identifies function used compute covariance matrix. See model_parameters(). vcov.type Deprecated. type-argument now included vcov.args. vcov.args List arguments passed function identified vcov.fun argument. function typically supplied sandwich clubSandwich packages. Please refer documentation (e.g., ?sandwich::vcovHAC) see list available arguments. string.pred Character vector,used headline predictor column. Default "Predictors". string.est Character vector, used column heading coefficients. Default based response scale, e.g. logistic regression models, "Odds Ratios" chosen, Poisson models "Incidence Rate Ratios" etc. Default specified "Estimate". string.std Character vector, used column heading standardized beta coefficients. Default "std. Beta". string.ci Character vector, used column heading confidence interval values. Default "CI". string.se Character vector, used column heading standard error values. Default "std. Error". string.std_se Character vector, used column heading standard error standardized coefficients. Default "standardized std. Error". string.std_ci Character vector, used column heading confidence intervals standardized coefficients. Default "standardized std. Error". string.p Character vector, used column heading p values. Default "p". string.std.p Character vector, used column heading p values. Default "std. p". string.df Character vector, used column heading degrees freedom. Default "df". string.stat Character vector, used test statistic. Default "Statistic". string.std.stat Character vector, used test statistic. Default "std. Statistic". string.resp Character vector, used column heading response level multinominal categorical models. Default "Response". string.intercept Character vector, used name intercept parameter. Default "(Intercept)". strings Named character vector, alternative arguments like string.ci string.p etc. name (lhs) must one string-indicator aforementioned arguments, value (rhs) string used column heading. E.g., strings = c(ci = "Conf.Int.", se = "std. Err") equivalent setting string.ci = "Conf.Int.", string.se = "std. Err". ci.hyphen Character vector, indicating hyphen confidence interval range. May HTML entity. See 'Examples'. minus.sign string, indicating minus sign negative numbers. May HTML entity. See 'Examples'. collapse.ci Logical, FALSE, CI values shown separate table column. collapse.se Logical, FALSE, SE values shown separate table column. linebreak Logical, TRUE collapse.ci = FALSE collapse.se = FALSE, inserts line break estimate CI resp. SE values. FALSE, values printed line estimate values. col.order Character vector, indicating columns printed order. Column names excluded col.order shown table output. However, column names included, shown table related argument (like show.est "estimate") set TRUE another valid value. Table columns printed order appear col.order. digits Amount decimals estimates digits.p Amount decimals p-values digits.rsq Amount decimals r-squared values digits.re Amount decimals random effects part summary table. emph.p Logical, TRUE, significant p-values shown bold faced. df.method, p.val Method computing degrees freedom p-values, standard errors confidence intervals (CI). applies mixed models. Use df.method = "wald" faster, less precise computation. use residual degrees freedom (returned df.residual()) linear mixed models, Inf degrees freedom model families. df.method = "kenward" (df.method = "kr") uses Kenward-Roger approximation degrees freedom. df.method = "satterthwaite" uses Satterthwaite's approximation "ml1" uses "m-l-1" heuristic see degrees_of_freedom details). Use show.df = TRUE show approximated degrees freedom coefficient. p.style Character, indicating p-values printed numeric value ("numeric"), 'stars' (asterisks) ("stars"), scientific ("scientific"). Scientific numeric style can combined "stars", e.g. "numeric_stars" p.threshold Numeric vector length 3, indicating treshold annotating p-values asterisks. applies p.style = "asterisk". p.adjust Character vector, NULL, indicates method adjust p-values. See p.adjust details. case Desired target case. Labels automatically converted specified character case. See snakecase::to_any_case() details argument. default, case specified, set "parsed", unless prefix.labels "none". prefix.labels either "label" ("l") "varname" ("v") case specified, set NULL - convenient default prefixing labels. auto.label Logical, TRUE (default),  data labelled,  term_labels called retrieve labels  coefficients, used predictor labels. data  labelled, format_parameters()  used create pretty labels. auto.label = FALSE, original variable names value labels (factor levels) used. prefix.labels Indicates whether value labels categorical variables prefixed, e.g. variable name variable label. See argument prefix term_labels details. bpe Stan-models (fitted rstanarm- brms-package), Bayesian point estimate , default, median posterior distribution. Use bpe define functions calculate Bayesian point estimate. bpe needs character naming specific function, passed fun-argument typical_value. , bpe = "mean" calculate mean value posterior distribution. CSS list user-defined style-sheet-definitions, according official CSS syntax. See 'Details' package-vignette. file Destination file, output saved file. NULL (default), output saved temporary file opened either IDE's viewer pane default web browser. use.viewer Logical, TRUE, HTML table shown IDE's viewer pane. FALSE viewer available, HTML table opened web browser. encoding Character vector, indicating charset encoding used variable value labels. Default "UTF-8". Windows Systems, encoding = "Windows-1252" might necessary proper display special characters.

Default NULL, weights used. title String, used table caption. var.labels Character vector variable names, used label variables output. value.labels Character vector (list character vectors) value labels supplied variables, used label variable values output. wrap.labels Numeric, determines many chars value, variable axis labels displayed one line line break inserted. sort.frq logical, indicates whether items ordered highest count first last category items. Use "first.asc" order ascending lowest count first category, "first.desc" order descending lowest count first category, "last.asc" order ascending lowest count last category, "last.desc" order descending lowest count last category, NULL (default) sorting. alternate.rows Logical, TRUE, rows printed alternatig colors (white light grey default). digits Numeric, amount digits decimal point rounding values. string.total label total N column. string.na label missing column/row. show.n logical, TRUE, adds total number cases group category labels. show.total logical, TRUE, additional column item's total N printed. show.na logical, TRUE, NA's (missing values) added output. show.skew logical, TRUE, additional column item's skewness printed. skewness retrieved describe-function psych-package. show.kurtosis Logical, TRUE, kurtosis item also shown (see kurtosi describe psych-package details. digits.stats amount digits rounding skewness kurtosis valuess. Default 2, .e. skewness kurtosis values 2 digits decimal point. file Destination file, output saved file. NULL (default), output saved temporary file opened either IDE's viewer pane default web browser. encoding Character vector, indicating charset encoding used variable value labels. Default "UTF-8". Windows Systems, encoding = "Windows-1252" might necessary proper display special characters. CSS list user-defined style-sheet-definitions, according official CSS syntax. See 'Details' package-vignette. use.viewer Logical, TRUE, HTML table shown IDE's viewer pane. FALSE viewer available, HTML table opened web browser. remove.spaces Logical, TRUE, leading spaces removed lines final string contains html-data. Use , want remove parantheses html-tags. html-source may look less pretty, may help exporting html-tables office tools.

title: Summary of stacked frequencies as HTML table — tab_stackfrq
code: # ------------------------------- # random sample # ------------------------------- # prepare data for 4-category likert scale, 5 items likert_4 <- data.frame(   as.factor(sample(1:4, 500, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0.4))),   as.factor(sample(1:4, 500, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.5, 0.25, 0.15, 0.1))),   as.factor(sample(1:4, 500, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.25, 0.1, 0.4, 0.25))),   as.factor(sample(1:4, 500, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.1, 0.4, 0.4, 0.1))),   as.factor(sample(1:4, 500, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.35, 0.25, 0.15, 0.25))) )  # create labels levels_4 <- c("Independent", "Slightly dependent",               "Dependent", "Severely dependent")  # create item labels items <- c("Q1", "Q2", "Q3", "Q4", "Q5")  # plot stacked frequencies of 5 (ordered) item-scales if (FALSE) { if (interactive()) {   tab_stackfrq(likert_4, value.labels = levels_4, var.labels = items)    # -------------------------------   # Data from the EUROFAMCARE sample dataset   #  Auto-detection of labels   # -------------------------------   data(efc)   # recveive first item of COPE-index scale   start <- which(colnames(efc) == "c82cop1")   # recveive first item of COPE-index scale   end <- which(colnames(efc) == "c90cop9")    tab_stackfrq(efc[, c(start:end)], alternate.rows = TRUE)    tab_stackfrq(efc[, c(start:end)], alternate.rows = TRUE,                show.n = TRUE, show.na = TRUE)    # --------------------------------   # User defined style sheet   # --------------------------------   tab_stackfrq(efc[, c(start:end)], alternate.rows = TRUE,                show.total = TRUE, show.skew = TRUE, show.kurtosis = TRUE,                CSS = list(css.ncol = "border-left:1px dotted black;",                           css.summary = "font-style:italic;")) } }

title: Summary of contingency tables as HTML table — tab_xtab
text: var.row Variable displayed table rows. var.col Cariable displayed table columns. weight.Vector weights applied weight cases. Must vector length input vector. Default NULL, weights used. title String, used table caption. var.labels Character vector variable names, used label variables output. value.labels Character vector (list character vectors) value labels supplied variables, used label variable values output. wrap.labels Numeric, determines many chars value, variable axis labels displayed one line line break inserted. show.obs Logical, TRUE, observed values shown show.cell.prc Logical, TRUE, cell percentage values shown show.row.prc Logical, TRUE, row percentage values shown show.col.prc Logical, TRUE, column percentage values shown show.exp Logical, TRUE, expected values also shown show.legend logical, TRUE, depending plot type function, legend added plot. show.na logical, TRUE, NA's (missing values) added output. show.summary Logical, TRUE, summary row chi-squared statistics, degrees freedom Cramer's V Phi coefficient p-value chi-squared statistics. drop.empty Logical, TRUE variable's values labeled, values observations still printed table (frequency 0). FALSE, values / factor levels occurrence data omitted output. statistics Name measure association computed. May one "auto", "cramer", "phi", "spearman", "kendall", "pearson" "fisher". See xtab_statistics. string.total Character label total column / row header digits Amount decimals estimates tdcol.n Color highlighting count (observed) values table cells. Default black. tdcol.expected Color highlighting expected values table cells. Default cyan. tdcol.cell Color highlighting cell percentage values table cells. Default red. tdcol.row Color highlighting row percentage values table cells. Default blue. tdcol.col Color highlighting column percentage values table cells. Default green. emph.total Logical, TRUE, total column row emphasized different background color. See emph.color. emph.color Logical, emph.total = TRUE, color value used painting background total column row. Default light grey. prc.sign percentage sign printed table cells, HTML-format. Default " %", hence percentage sign non-breaking-space percentage value. hundret Default value indicates 100-percent column-sums (since rounding values may lead non-exact results). Default "100.0". CSS list user-defined style-sheet-definitions, according official CSS syntax. See 'Details' package-vignette. encoding String, indicating charset encoding used variable value labels. Default NULL, encoding auto-detected depending platform (e.g., "UTF-8" Unix "Windows-1252" Windows OS). Change encoding specific chars properly displayed (e.g. German umlauts). file Destination file, output saved file. NULL (default), output saved temporary file opened either IDE's viewer pane default web browser. use.viewer Logical, TRUE, HTML table shown IDE's viewer pane. FALSE viewer available, HTML table opened web browser. remove.spaces Logical, TRUE, leading spaces removed lines final string contains html-data. Use , want remove parantheses html-tags. html-source may look less pretty, may help exporting html-tables office tools. ... arguments, currently passed test statistics functions chisq.test() fisher.test().

title: Summary of contingency tables as HTML table — tab_xtab
text: Invisibly returns  web page style sheet (page.style), web page content (page.content), complete html-output (page.complete) html-table inline-css use knitr (knitr) use.

title: Summary of contingency tables as HTML table — tab_xtab
code: # prepare sample data set data(efc)  # print simple cross table with labels if (FALSE) { if (interactive()) {   tab_xtab(efc$e16sex, efc$e42dep)    # print cross table with manually set   # labels and expected values   tab_xtab(     efc$e16sex,     efc$e42dep,     var.labels = c("Elder's gender", "Elder's dependency"),     show.exp = TRUE   )    # print minimal cross table with labels, total col/row highlighted   tab_xtab(efc$e16sex, efc$e42dep, show.cell.prc = FALSE, emph.total = TRUE)    # User defined style sheet   tab_xtab(efc$e16sex, efc$e42dep,            CSS = list(css.table = "border: 2px solid;",                       css.tdata = "border: 1px solid;",                       css.horline = "border-bottom: double blue;"))    # ordinal data, use Kendall's tau   tab_xtab(efc$e42dep, efc$quol_5, statistics = "kendall")    # calculate Spearman's rho, with continuity correction   tab_xtab(     efc$e42dep,     efc$quol_5,     statistics = "spearman",     exact = FALSE,     continuity = TRUE   ) } }

title: sjPlot 2.8.6
text: dv.labels = "" tab_model(), row names dependent variables omitted.

title: sjPlot 2.8.6
text: Fix CRAN check issues (removed cross-references archived packages). minus.sign argument tab_model() now works. show.std = TRUE tab_model() exponentiate standardized coefficients non-Gaussian models.

title: sjPlot 2.8.5
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-24

title: sjPlot 2.8.5
text: tab_model() gains argument df.method, replace less generic p.val argument future. Currently, df.method alias p.val.

title: sjPlot 2.8.5
text: Fixed issue wrong n’s plot_stackfrq() weights applied. Fixed issue plot_stackfrq() weights applied items sorted. Fixed issue plot_models() models without intercept. Fixed issue wrong legend labelling plot_models() showing p-stars. Fixed issue plot_model() type = "int" detecting interaction terms partly parenthesis (like * (b + c)). Fixed issue tab_model() arguments show.stat = TRUE show.std = TRUE, related statistic CI columns standardized coefficients shown. Fixed issue tab_model() brmsfit models longer show random effects information last update performance package. Fixed issue argument show.rownames tab_df().

title: sjPlot 2.8.4
text: CRAN release: 2020-05-24

title: sjPlot 2.8.4
text: robust estimation (argument vcov.fun tab_model() plot_model()) now also uses thus accepts estimation-types package clubSandwich. tab_model() now accepts options p.val supported parameters::model_parameters(). p.style argument tab_model() slightly revised, now also accepts "scientific" option scientific notation p-values. tab_model() gets digits.re argument define decimal part random effects summary. plot_models() gains value.size line.size arguments, similar plot_model(). plot_models() sort coefficients natural order now.

title: sjPlot 2.8.4
text: Fixed bug plot_xtab() wrong order legend labels. Fixed bug plot_models() wrong axis title exponentiated coefficients. Fixed bug tab_model() show standard error standardized coefficients show.se = TRUE.

title: sjPlot 2.8.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-09

title: sjPlot 2.8.3
text: tab_model() plot_model() now support clogit models (requires latest update package insight).

title: sjPlot 2.8.3
text: tab_model() gets p.adjust argument adjust p-values multiple comparisons. tab_model(), plot_model() plot_models() get robust-argument easily compute standard errors, confidence intervals p-values based robust estimation variance-covariance matrix. robust just convenient shortcut vcov.fun vcov.type.

title: sjPlot 2.8.3
text: Fixed issue tab_model() plot_model() certain cases coefficients estimated NA. Fixed issue tab_model() collapse.ci Bayesian models. Fixed issue tab_model() p.val="kr" show.df=TRUE. Fixed issue tab_model() formatting issues p-values standardized coefficients requested. Fixed issue tab_model() due changes packages sjPlot depends .

title: sjPlot 2.8.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-01-23

title: sjPlot 2.8.2
text: sjt.itemanalysis() now named tab_itemscale(). sjt.xtab() now named tab_xtab().

title: sjPlot 2.8.2
text: Improved handling tab_model() robust estimation general Kenward-Roger Satterthwaite approximations particular linear mixed models. Revised code cope forthcoming tidyselect-update.

title: sjPlot 2.8.2
text: Improved tab_df() now uses value labels factors instead numeric values. Fixed issues related lates brms-update.

title: sjPlot 2.8.1

title: sjPlot 2.8.1

title: sjPlot 2.8.1

Fixed bug tab_model() show.reflvl = TRUE. Fixed bug tab_model() labels coefficients matching correct coefficients.

title: sjPlot 2.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-11-18

title: sjPlot 2.8.0
text: Cluster functions removed, now re-implemented parameters package.

title: sjPlot 2.8.0
text: Standardization model parameters (plot_model() tab_model()) now uses standardization based refitting model (see vignette details).

title: sjPlot 2.8.0
text: plot_model() gets type = "emm" marginal effects plot type, similar type = "eff". See Plotting Marginal Effects Regression Models details. verbose-argument view_df() now defaults FALSE. Updated re-arranged internal color palette, especially better behaviour selecting colors continuous palettes (see show_pals()).

title: sjPlot 2.8.0
text: sort.est = NULL plot_model() now preserves original order coefficients. Fixed bug automatic axis labelling plot_frq() non-labelled, numeric values. Fixed bug plot_frq() plotting factors. Arguments string.std_ci string.std_se longer ignored tab_model().

title: sjPlot 2.7.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-29

title: sjPlot 2.7.2
text: Replaced performance::principal_component() parameters::principal_component(). Fixed CRAN check issues, due latest bayestestR update.

title: sjPlot 2.7.2
text: sjp.grpfrq() now names plot_grpfrq(). sjp.xtab() now names plot_xtab().

title: sjPlot 2.7.2
text: plot_grid() gets tags-argument add tags plot-panels.

title: sjPlot 2.7.2
text: Fixed bug plot_stackfrq() data frames many missing values. Fixed bug sorting frequencies plot_frq() vector labels values. Fixed bug tab_model() show.reflvl = TRUE insert reference category first place, alphabetical order.

title: sjPlot 2.7.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-07

title: sjPlot 2.7.1
text: Minor revisions meet changes forthcoming update tidyr. new color palettes added (see show_sjplot_pals()).

title: sjPlot 2.7.1
text: tab_model() now supports gamlss models. tab_df() gets digits argument, round numeric values output.

title: sjPlot 2.7.1
text: Fixed bug tab_model() show.df = TRUE lmerModLmerTest. Fixed bug tab_stackfrq() items different amount valid values.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-08-02

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: sjp.stackfrq() renamed plot_stackfrq(). sjt.stackfrq() renamed tab_stackfrq().

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: showed category labels top bottom legends two rows six categories. Also, categories ordered column wise instead row wise. behaviour can now controlled grouped likert plots, using group.legend.options. ordering now defaults row wise user can force categories onto single row. now automatically adjusts labels avoid overlapping.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: now supports wbm()-models panelr-package. gets show.aicc-argument show second order AIC. gets show.reflvl-argument show reference level factors. gets string.std_se string.std_ci-argument change column header standard errors confidence intervals standardized coefficients. longer prints message default p-values mixed models based Wald approximation. show.ci50 defaults FALSE now.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: sjt.itemanalysis() now works ordered factors. clearer error message added unordered factors used. old error message helpful. factor.groups argument can now "auto" detect factor groups based pca Varimax rotation.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: sjp.stackfrq() renamed plot_stackfrq(). sjp.stackfrq() (now named: plot_stackfrq()) gets show.n-argument also show count values. option can combined show.prc. sjp.stackfrq() (now named: plot_stackfrq()) now also works grouped data frames.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: plot_model() now supports wbm()-models panelr-package.

title: sjPlot 2.7.0
text: plot_model(type = "int") now also recognized interaction terms : formula. Argument string.est tab_model() overwrite default label estimate-column-header. Minor fix tab_model() mixed models can’t compute R2. Fix issue tab_model() printing robust standard errors CI (.e. using arguments vcov*). plot_likert() option reverse.scale = TRUE resulted values = "sum.inside" outside way around. fixed now. view_df() mixed labels frequency values value labels present, values data. Argument wrap.labels plot_frq() properly work factor levels. Fix issue plot_models() stopped models. Fix issue sjt.stackfrq(), show.na = TRUE items zero-values.

title: sjPlot 2.6.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-04-27

title: sjPlot 2.6.3

title: sjPlot 2.6.3

title: sjPlot 2.6.3

title: sjPlot 2.6.3

title: sjPlot 2.6.3
text: plot_frq() (former sjp.frq()) now pipe-consistent syntax, enables plotting multiple variables one function call supports grouped data frames. plot_model() gets additional arguments vcov.fun, vcov.type vcov.args passed sjstats::robust(), calculate different types (clustered) robust standard errors. sjt.xtab(), sjp.xtab(), plot_frq() sjp.grpfrq() get drop.empty()-argument, drop values / factor levels observations output.

title: sjPlot 2.6.3
text: Legend labels inverted brms-models plot_model(..., type = "diag"). Legend labels duplicated marginal effects plots color ="bw" legend.title specified. Fixed encoding issues help-files. view_df() truncate frequency- percentage-values variables value labels truncated certain maximum number. tab_model() print number observations coxph-models.

title: sjPlot 2.6.2

title: sjPlot 2.6.2

title: sjPlot 2.6.2

Fix issue sjp.frq() correct axis labels non-labelled character vectors.

title: sjPlot 2.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-10-14

title: sjPlot 2.6.1
text: Removed defunct functions.

title: sjPlot 2.6.1
text: sjt.lm(), sjt.glm(), sjt.lmer() sjt.glmer() now deprecated. Please use tab_model() instead.

title: sjPlot 2.6.1
text: Arguments dot.size line.size plot_model() now also apply marginal effects diagnostic plots. plot_model() now uses free x-axis scale facets models zero-inflated part. plot_model() now shows multiple plots models zero-inflated parts grids = FALSE. tab_model() gets p.style p.threshold argument indicate significance levels asteriks, determine threshold estimate considered significant. plot_model() plot_models() get p.threshold argument determine threshold estimate considered significant.

title: sjPlot 2.6.1

title: sjPlot 2.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-23

title: sjPlot 2.6.0

title: sjPlot 2.6.0

Argument hide.progress view_df() deprecated. Please use verbose now. statistics-argument sjt.xtab() gets "fisher"-option, force Fisher’s Exact Test used.

title: sjPlot 2.6.0
text: Following functions now defunct: sjp.lm(), sjp.glm(), sjp.lmer(), sjp.glmer() sjp.int(). Please use plot_model() instead. sjt.frq(). Please use sjmisc::frq(= "v") instead.

New colour scales ggplot-objects: scale_fill_sjplot() scale_color_sjplot(). provide predifined colour palettes package. show_sjplot_pals() show predefined colour palettes provided package. sjplot_pal() return colour values specific palette.

text: Following functions now defunct: sjt.grpmean(), sjt.mwu() sjt.df(). replacements sjstats::grpmean(), sjstats::mwu() tab_df() resp. tab_dfs().

title: sjPlot 2.5.0
text: plot_model() plot_models() get prefix.labels-argument, prefix automatically retrieved term labels either related variable name label. plot_model() gets show.zeroinf-argument show hide zero-inflation-part models plot. plot_model() gets jitter-argument add random variation data points plot types accept show.data = TRUE. plot_model() gets legend.title-argument define legend title plots display legend. plot_model() now passes arguments ... ggeffects::plot() marginal effects plots. plot_model() now plots zero-inflated part model brmsfit-objects. plot_model() now plots multivariate response models, .e. models multiple outcomes. Diagnostic plots plot_model() (type = "diag") can now also used brmsfit-objects. Axis limits diagnostic plots plot_model() (type = "diag") Stan-models (brmsfit stanreg resp. stanfit) can now set axis.lim-argument. grid.breaks-argument plot_model() plot_models() now also takes vector values directly define grid breaks plot. Better default calculation grid breaks plot_model() plot_models() grid.breaks-argument length one. terms-argument plot_model() now also allows specification range numeric values square brackets marginal effects plots, e.g. terms = "age [30:50]" terms = "age [pretty]". coefficient-plots, terms- rm.terms-arguments plot_model() now also allows specification factor levels categorical terms. Coefficients indicted factor levels kept resp. removed (see ?plot_model details). plot_model() now supports clmm-objects (package ordinal). plot_model(type = "diag") now also shows random-effects QQ-plots glmmTMB-models, also plots random-effects QQ-plots random effects (model one random effect term).

title: sjPlot 2.5.0
text: plot_model(type = "re") now supports standard errors confidence intervals glmmTMB-objects. Fixed typo glmmTMB-tidier, may returned wrong data zero-inflation part model. Multiple random intercepts multilevel models fitted brms area now shown facet per intercept. Remove unnecessary warning sjp.likert() uneven category count neutral category specified. plot_model(type = "int") automatically select mdrt.values properly non-integer variables. sjp.grpfrq() now correctly uses complete space facets facet.grid = TRUE. sjp.grpfrq(type = "boxplot") correctly label x-axis one category elements vector. Problems German umlauts printing HTML tables fixed.
